My name is CONNER LINZY. I'm a web developer based in Charlotte, NC. I specialize in lightweight, scalable front-end architecture with the React framework. I strive to create regenerative technology that helps people and solves real problems.

BlueH2O Irrigation

From loading a web page to sending an IM, every action on the web requires energy. If the internet were a country, it will to rank #4 in the world for its rate of emissions by 2025. In light of the climate crisis, we must design products that are future-friendly, and do not consume resources unnecessarily. Writing performant code, thoughtfully using images and videos, and selecting green hosting services are the most impactful things web developers can do to shift toward a regenerative web and a clean earth for future generations.

Creating technologies that are sensitive to human nature, and do not try to exploit, addict, or manipulate users. Psychological factors in UX should be considered to ensure products promote a healthy mind and a sense of well-being. Additionally, our information infrastucture and public discourse is now shaped by the internet, and it's our responsibility to make products that are inherently good for society, and do not inadvertently divide, outrage, or misinform.

Creating technologies at are available to all people, regardless of their hardware, language, location, or abilities. Web developers can maintain the inclusive culture of the internet by focusing on, above all, a high quality user experience that adheres to responsive design, internationalization, and W3C standards.

Github User Search
